clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: CRM is something that is not that hard, and if I just set an alarm or a timer to input clients for 10 minutes a day, it's not that hard.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Bari speaks with practical, no-BS directness — she's confessional about what she doesn't do well, but frames solutions as achievable, not aspirational.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: A $40M producer admits she struggles with the same basic thing everyone hates — and her fix is stupidly simple, not some guru nonsense.

HOOK.text: A $40 million producer just admitted she's terrible at CRM.
HOOK.production_note: Text on screen: '$40M PRODUCER'. Cut to Bari's face mid-confession.

SETUP.text: Bari Mill closes 40 million a year in Chicago. And the thing she avoids most? The same thing you do. Updating her database. But here's what she figured out.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll of Chicago skyline, then cut to Bari speaking. Text overlay: 'Chicago Top Producer'

INSIGHT.text: She said: 'CRM is something that is not that hard, and if I just set an alarm or a timer to input clients for 10 minutes a day, it's not that hard.' Ten minutes. Not an hour. Not a Sunday afternoon catch-up session where you hate your life. A timer. Every day. She treats it like brushing her teeth — boring, non-negotiable, done before she can talk herself out of it.
INSIGHT.production_note: Show phone timer being set for 10 minutes. Cut between Bari's quote and screen recording of CRM being updated. Text overlay: '10 MINUTES. EVERY DAY.'

REFRAME.text: Because the agents who do 40 million aren't superhuman. They just don't let the boring stuff pile up into a crisis. Ten minutes today beats three hours of panic next month.
REFRAME.production_note: Split screen: messy CRM vs. clean CRM. Cut to Bari nodding.

CTA.text: So set the timer. Right now. Before you close this app. Ten minutes. See if she's right.
CTA.production_note: Close-up of phone timer starting. Text: 'SET THE TIMER NOW.' Fade to Bari's face.

caption: 40M producer admits she's bad at CRM. Her fix? 10 minutes a day. That's it.
